result.execSummary:
The defendant William C Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay a fine in the amount of $50.00 PLUS all costs and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) by 9-21-15. If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William C Adams

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William C Adams in court with attorney John P Carlson.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
Court ordered defendant is to pay a fine in the amount of $50.00 PLUS all costs and surcharges by 9-21-2015.  If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant. 
Court ordered defendant to pay mandatory $200.00 DNA surcharge by 9-21-2015.  If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
 Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk jks

Defendant William C Adams in court with attorney John P Carlson.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense requests time to go over offer and discovery with defendant to decide how to proceed in this matter.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 46. jks  Status conference scheduled for 03-20-2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 02-25-2015 at 01:30 pm.

As an additional condition of bail:
No firearms 
No dangerous weapons

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant William C Adams in court with attorney John P Carlson.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-032

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 46.
Clerk:  jms
